topic.title: Test example
topic.shortdesc: This should test attributes on the example tag; there are not very many un-common ones (mostly spectitle).

body.example:
This is a simple example with @outputclass.Here is some text.
Here is a paragraph.
Here is another paragraph.

This really is a simple example.Here is some text.
Here is a paragraph.
Here is another paragraph.

Here is some text.
Here is a paragraph.
Here is another paragraph.

Example with title and @spectitleHere is some text.
Here is a paragraph.
Here is another paragraph.

Example with 2 titlessecond titleHere is some text.
Here is a paragraph.
Here is another paragraph.

Example with 2 titles and
@spectitlesecond titleHere is some text.
Here is
a paragraph.
Here is another paragraph.

example with langauge=fr-beHere is some text.
Here is a paragraph.
Here is another paragraph.

Example with everythingHere is some text.
Here is a paragraph.
Here is another paragraph.

topic.title: Example Test
topic.shortdesc: This is a test that allows everything possible in the <example> element. It should look remarkably similar to the <section> test.

body.example:
My ExampleAny example should of course start with basic text. Followed by other stuff. As for the other stuff, we'll put phrase-level stuff first. test apiname test bold (test boolean ->) test cite test cmdname test codeph test filepath test footnote test italic test inline image: test indexterm test keyword test menucascade/uicontrol test msgnum test msgph [skipping object] test option test parmname test ph testing a quote (test state -> ) test sub test sup test synph test systemoutput test term tm to amazon test tt test underlined test uicontrol test uicontrol/shortcut test userinput test varname test wintitle test xref to the top
Now I will add the block-like elements, in reverse order:
test ul
test ul again
test ul again again test having a second example titletesting a table in an example
testing a
basic table
testing a syntaxdiagram
simple table simpler table end of simple table
simple table simpler table end of simple table
test a screen elementThis is required cleanup in my exampletest pre test pre test pre pt this is a parml test
pt this is a parml test
testing a paragraph. That's a novel idea. well, if it is I should put it in <lq>.
test ol
test ol again
test ol a third time testing a note, just a plain old note, not a special notetest msgblock test msgblock test msgblockLQ: Darryl Strawberry was sentenced to 18 months in prison Monday for violating his probation on a 1999 conviction on drug and solicitation of prostitution charges.test lines test lines test lines(that was a placement=break image)Figure in an example
Placing a figure in an example placing a draft-comment in the example
dl in section this is what a dl in an example looks like
dl in section this is what a dl in an example looks like test codeblock test codeblock test codeblock simple list here
